intro: Spermacoce multibracteata, commonly known as the many-bract sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
